resources.string: ...in case you wonder what this is all about.
Some of Oversec's cutting edge privacy features
Messages are decrypted on-the-fly and only while shown on screen - decrypted text is never stored.

Symmetric encryption using ChaCha20 Cipher and Poly1305 MAC
with 256 Bit Keys
Encrypted data can be hidden behind decoy text, conversations look inconspicuous without Oversec

Transparently encrypts and decrypts any text in any app.
(Including GMail App)
Supports strong PGP Public Key Encryption (powered by xxx)
Protocol and encryption related code is Open-Source, can be verified by 3rd parties.

Oversec constantly monitors the text on your screen. When it finds an encrypted text, it tries to decrypt it and then shows the decrypted text as an overlay in place of the encrypted text.

In order to encrypt a text, Oversec shows a button next to an active input field. After having entered the secret text, tapping that button makes Oversec read the text, encrypt it and put back the encrypted text into the field. It is now ready to be sent in the subjacent app as usual - the app doesn't even know that it is sending encrypted data!

Oversec also features a unique way of encoding encrypted messages. It stores the encrypted text in invisible (zero-width) characters and let's you add decoy text at the end. That way, a message will just show e.g. "The sun is shining today!" with no visible sign of any encryption, whereas in reality it contains a hidden encrypted message.

You may also encrypt and send photos through Oversec - its unique camera mode even allows you to take and send an encrypted photo without ever storing the original photo on the device.
Sending and receiving PGP encrypted emails
Basically Oversec works with ANY app, but here's an incomplete list of popular apps we have verified to work with Oversec:
If an app is not listed here, please just give it a try, Oversec is designed to work with ANY app!
No Playstore? No Problem! Direct APK download
